definition[0]: to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction
example[0]: Jill darted forward and pulled him away from the fire.
definition[1]: to look at someone or something very quickly
example[1]: Tom darted a terrified glance over his shoulder at his pursuers.
definition[2]: a small pointed object that is thrown or shot as a weapon, or one that is thrown in the game of darts
definition[3]: a sudden quick movement in a particular direction
example[3]: The prisoner made a dart for the door.
definition[4]: a small fold put into a piece of clothing to make it fit better
